column4: i'm having a problem with my wireless connection.  it connects, and i get an ip address, but when i try to ping the router i get destination host unreachable.  anybody have any ideas?
can you liste the two IPs and show us the output of route -n ?
which two ips?
the IP you gotfrom your AP as well as the one you are trying to ping
i got 192.168.1.103 from the ap, and i'm trying to ping 192.168.1.1
ok, what's the output of route -n look like?
what's the only line?
what about tracepath 192.168.1.1?
i thought it did.  i compared it to the connectino on this computer
and the computer you're on now pings 192.168.1.1 with no problem?
it gives childsplay.local (192.168.1.103) .06ms pmtu 1500
wait.. it listed itself twice??
yep
doesn't report any error?
no errors

i've seen a similar probllem.  a friend of mine i talked into ubuntu had trouble when he went from dial up to dsl.  it would connect, but not use the connection.  he eventually just reinstalled and the installer picked it right up.
have you checked dmesg for error messages? it's weird if your route is right and the other box can ping it that you can't
pinging it seems to be timing out
hm, strange
very
i dont see any errors in the dmesg
any ideas?
in /etc/network/interfaces should the wireless be the first device, orr the loopback? and does it matter
